definitions.definition: a person who receives or entertains other people as guests.
a person, place, or organization that holds and organizes an event to which others are invited.
examples: Innsbruck once played host to the Winter Olympics

definitions.definition: an area in which particular living things are found.
examples: Australia is host to some of the world's most dangerous animals

definitions.definition: the landlord or landlady of a pub.
examples: mine host raised his glass of whiskey

definitions.definition: the moderator or emcee of a television or radio program.
examples: presenter, anchor, anchorman, anchorwoman, announcer, master of ceremonies, ringmaster; emcee the host of a TV series

definitions.definition: an animal or plant on or in which a parasite or commensal organism lives.
a living cell in which a virus multiplies.
examples: noun: host cell; plural noun: host cells

definitions.definition: a person or animal that has received transplanted tissue or a transplanted organ.
a computer that mediates multiple access to databases mounted on it or provides other services to a computer network.
act as host at (an event) or for (a television or radio program).
examples: give, have, hold, throw, put on, provide, arrange, organize More"Diane hosted a dinner party"present, introduce, front, anchor, announce; informalemcee "Jack hosted the show"MoreDiane hosted a dinner partypresent, introduce, front, anchor, announce; emcee Jack hosted the show

definitions.definition: store (a website or other data) on a server or other computer so that it can be accessed over the Internet.
examples: Columbia University currently hosts some 400 websites

definitions.definition: a large number of people or things.
examples: a host of memories rushed into her mind

definitions.definition: (in biblical use) the sun, moon, and stars.
the bread consecrated in the Eucharist.
